revised_title: The Role of Modified Plant Pigments in Lepidopterous Larvae Coloration
tldr: The author investigates the role of modified plant pigments in the coloration of certain Lepidopterous larvae. By feeding larvae with different types of plant parts, the author demonstrates that the larvae's colors are largely due to modified chlorophyll derived from their food, supporting the theory that these pigments play a significant role in their coloration.
